title: May 5
description:
Milo is writing poems, or so he calls them. They are more like songs, really. The funny thing is that they are abstract. They are strings of nonsensical syllables but still, he writes them down scrupulously. Here is one for your listening pleasure.

Proud moment for Lucie this week: after practicing Cuong Nhu karate for almost two years, she earned her green belt.

children.title: Belt Test
children.description: Our dojo teaches students of all ages. Kids, teens and adults have separate classes but they may find themselves together at belt tests. Lucie was grouped with 3 kids testing for their green belts. Kids follow a different path until green belt; they have more colors of belt in between (yellow, purple and blue).

children.title: Green Belt
children.description:
At the end of the grueling 3-hour test, Sensei John ceremoniously hands Lucie her new belt.

The test took so long because some brown belts were also testing. The higher ranks have to do all sort of fancy stuff, like board breaking and sparring fights.

children.title: New Belt
children.description: Lucie had painted her finger nails green for good luck.

children.title: Doggy Day Care
children.description: For the last couple of months, Dean and Lucie arranged their work schedules so that one of them would always be home to supervise Higgsy. That's no longer possible but the pup is still a little too young to spend an entire day by herself. So, on some days, we drop her off a Every Dog Has Its Day Care.

children.title: Lobby
children.description: Higgsy loves it. She wags her tail and pulls on her leash as soon as she realizes where we are taking her. She spends the day hanging out with other dogs and dog-loving humans. What's not to like?

children.title: Pool
children.description:
On her first day at doggy daycare, Higgsy was sent home with a "report card" telling us how much she enjoyed herself. They also posted a photo of her on their Facebook page.

The place is dog paradise. They have a playground structure for the pooches to climb on and even a water play area. Extravagant.

children.title: Band
children.description: At the end-of-year show, Connor (in suit and blue T-shirt) performed in a band with his friends Marco, Aidan and Aidan's dad Matt while the rest of the fourth graders sang. It was awesome!

children.title: Moussaillons
children.description: The third graders sang nautical songs, including the classic Santiano.

children.title: Harp
children.description: Xanthe is really good on the harp. Impressive.

children.title: Felix
children.description: The fifth graders performed songs about the moon.

children.title: Auction Gala
children.description:
Saturday night was the annual fancy Auction Gala at the Claremont Hotel hosted by Ecole Bilingue. It's a fund raiser and they indeed successfully raided funds from our pockets.

Dean can be seen here bidding a week-long rental in Tahoe. We won. We are going skiing next February! This is not something we had been planning on but it sounds like a lot of fun.

children.title: Hihalahi
children.description: Here is a sample poem / song by Milo. It fits very well with the way he draws. Even now, he is not a big fan of figurative drawings. He prefers swirls of colors and abstract organic shapes with possibly a slight nod at realism (eyes, hands...)

children.title: Paracosm
children.description:
Flipping through Wired magazine this week, Lucie learned a new word: paracosm. Do you know what it is?

Definition: A paracosm is a detailed imaginary world, or fantasy world, involving humans and/or animals, or perhaps even fantasy or alien creations. Commonly having its own geography, history, and language, it is an experience that is often developed during childhood and continues over a long period of time: months or even years.

Now we have a word for Felix's favorite activity in the World: paracosmic play.

children.title: Papo
children.description:
Paracosmic play does not require any props but Felix occasionally likes to get his Papo figurines in on the action. Other times, he simply talks his brother or his friends through an adventure in his World.

Also, Felix is starting to write down some of the details of his imaginary World (list of creatures, list of weapons, maps, etc). Still, most of it is in his head and only in his head. It's an evolving universe.

children.title: Squares
children.description:
Lucie protested... must you kids play in our bedroom?

Yes, they replied, because it's the only room in the house with a square floor pattern. Creatures move square by square during their adventure, like on a giant D&D mat.

children.title: Gorilla
children.description: According to <cite>Wired Magazine</cite>, a new study reveals that among highly smart and successful adults, a large majority of them engaged in extensive paracosmic play as children (at a much higher percentage than the population at large). It's probably too early to call Felix a genius, but it's nice to hear anyway.

children.title: Lemonade
children.description: Milo, George and Ulysses had a slumber party at Thibaud and André's house for Thibaud's birthday. In the morning, the monkey-loving friends had a brownie-and-lemonade stand to raise money for orangutans.
